text: The president of the Maldives (ދިވެހިރާއްޖޭގެ ރައީސުލްޖުމްހޫރިއްޔާ) is the head of state and head of government of the Republic of Maldives. ==List== Portrait Name Election Term of office Party Vice President Took office Left office Time in office Presidents of the First Republic (1953–1954) 1 Mohamed Amin Didi 1952 1 January 1953 2 September 1953 Rayyithunge Muthagaddim Party Ibrahim Muhammad Didi — Ibrahim Muhammad Didi — 2 September 1953 7 March 1954 Rayyithunge Muthagaddim Party Sultanate of the Maldives (1954–1968) — Muhammad Fareed Didi — 7 March 1954 11 November 1968 The Royal Family — Presidents of the Second Republic (1968–present) Post restored 2 Ibrahim Nasir 1968 11 November 1968 11 November 1973 10 years Independent Office abolished 1973 11 November 1973 11 November 1978 Abdul Sattar Moosa Didi Ahmad Hilmy Didi Ibrahim Shihab Ali Maniku 3 Maumoon Abdul Gayoom 1978 11 November 1978 11 November 1983 30 years Independent Office abolished 1983 11 November 1983 11 November 1988 1988 11 November 1988 11 November 1993 1993 11 November 1993 11 November 1998 1998 11 November 1998 11 November 2003 2003 11 November 2003 11 November 2008 Dhivehi Rayyithunge Party 4 Mohamed Nasheed 2008 11 November 2008 7 February 2012 Maldivian Democratic Party Mohammed Waheed Hassan 5 Mohammed Waheed Hassan — 7 February 2012 17 November 2013 Gaumee Itthihaad Mohammed Waheed Deen 6 Abdulla Yameen 2013 17 November 2013 17 November 2018 5 years Progressive Party of Maldives Mohamed Jameel Ahmed Ahmed Adeeb Abdulla Jihad 7 Ibrahim Mohamed Solih 2018 17 November 2018 17 November 2023 Maldivian Democratic Party Faisal Naseem 9 Mohamed Muizzu 2023 17 November 2023 Incumbent People's National Congress Hussain Mohamed Latheef ==References==
title: President of the Maldives
